name: Nicotine Patch (Nicoderm)
summary: A transdermal nicotine replacement therapy (NRT) used to help people quit smoking by delivering a steady dose of nicotine through the skin.
description: The nicotine patch is a smoking cessation aid that provides continuous delivery of nicotine through the skin over 16 or 24 hours. It helps reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms associated with quitting smoking. Patches come in various strengths to allow gradual tapering of nicotine dosage.

metadata.fda_pregnancy_category: D (risk if continued smoking outweighs NRT use; should be supervised)

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to nicotine or patch adhesives

sections.text: Delivers nicotine through the skin into the bloodstream, stimulating nicotinic acetylcholine receptors to reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms.

adult.typical: 21 mg/day for 6 weeks, then 14 mg/day for 2 weeks, then 7 mg/day for 2 weeks (for >10 cigarettes/day smokers)
adult.lower_use: 14 mg/day for 6 weeks, then 7 mg/day for 2 weeks (for ≤10 cigarettes/day smokers)

sections.tapering: Step-down approach using progressively lower dose patches

items: Transdermal patches: 7 mg/24 hr, 14 mg/24 hr, 21 mg/24 hr

sections.text: Nicotine absorption begins within 30 minutes; provides steady levels over the patch's wear time (16 or 24 hours).

other: Remove patch before MRI to avoid burns from metallic components
Rotate application sites daily to minimize skin irritation

items.risk: Smoking cessation may alter drug metabolism

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks and under medical supervision
sections.lactation: Nicotine passes into breast milk; avoid or use immediately after breastfeeding
sections.pediatrics: Not recommended under age 18 without supervision

sections.text: Reduce nicotine dose gradually over 8–10 weeks.

items: May cause vivid dreams or insomnia—consider removing patch at night
Useful for patients who prefer consistent nicotine delivery over the day

items.label: US Public Health Service Clinical Practice Guideline: Treating Tobacco Use and Dependence

seo.title: Nicotine Patch (Nicoderm): Smoking Cessation Aid
seo.description: Nicotine patches provide continuous nicotine delivery through the skin to reduce cravings and withdrawal symptoms during smoking cessation.
